Join us in playing an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes!Cytel provides unrivalled biostatistics and operations research to improve drug development success rates, crucial for human welfare. Focused on using innovative applications of statistical science and adaptive clinical trial design, Cytel is at the cutting edge of technology and human ingenuity, driving healthcare forward.We are hiring a remote Senior/Principal Biostatistician to lead and support clinical trials for a major pharma company in the therapeutic area of Oncology. This position reports to the Director, Biostatistics in the FSP Services business unit in Cytel. The level of the position will be determined by the candidate’s experience level.Your ImpactAs a Senior/Principal Biostatistician, you will provide statistics input into the end to end process of clinical trials, including protocol development, review and development of SAP, associated TFL shells and specifications to programmers, review of ADaM and SDTM datasets, preparation, review, and interpretation of statistical analyses, and preparation of submission data packages for regulatory agencies.What We Are Looking For Master’s or PhD in Bioinformatics, Biostatistics or related field3-5 years’ experience in clinical trials, with experience serving at a clinical study lead Very good knowledge of research methodology and statistical approaches to analyzing dataUnderstanding the Pharmaceutical industry and regulatory requirements for the drug development Experience working on Oncology trials is requiredExperience in modelling Omics data gene expression, protein expression, immunogenicity and MRD/DNA dataExperience working with oncology biomarker statistics is a nice to haveStrong R programming skills (e.g., must be able to run models and verify outputs)Knowledge of SAS programming is a nice to haveEffective communicator:able to explain methodology and consequences of decisions in lay termsable to summarize questions from statistics team over to programmersTeam player; willingness to go the extra distance to get results, meet deadlines, etc. Ability to collaborate effectively in a dynamic, cross-functional matrix environmentAbility to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environmentAbility to be flexible when priorities change and deal with ambiguity Excellent organizational and time management skillsDetailed-orientedRelevant Statistical Techniques NeededProficiency in R statistical procedures for conducting efficacy and safety analysesExperience with applicable statistical techniques in oncology (longitudinal data analyses, survival analyses, regression models, parametric and non parametric methods, multivariate modeling, machine learning)Experience with randomized controlled trials and observational studiesExperience with relevant ICH guidelinesExperience with CDISC standards
